5:30 PM

May 14, 2018

I. CITY MANAGER'S AGENDA
1. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the appointment
of the following person as a member of the Community Preservation Act Committee, effective May
14, 2018 for a term of 5-years: Corinne Espinoza
CMA 2018 #109
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

2. Transmitting Communication from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the appropriation
of $18,288 from the Commonwealth of Massachusetts State 911 Support Grant to the Emergency
Communications Department Salary and Wages Account to provide funds for overtime costs related
to the implementation of the Wireless Direct Program.
CMA 2018 #110
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon,
Mayor McGovern, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey,
Councillor Zondervan

3. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to Awaiting Report
Item Number 18-31, regarding coordinating with the MBTA on maintenance issues of the Harvard
Square MBTA public restrooms.
CMA 2018 #111
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

4. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to Awaiting Report
Item Number 18-13, regarding electric vehicles.
CMA 2018 #112
RESULT:
REFERRED TO COMMITTEE TRANSPORTATION AND PUBLIC
UTILITIES

5. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to Awaiting Report
Item Numbers 18-20 and 18-51, regarding Rufo Road.
CMA 2018 #113
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

PAGE 2

May 14, 2018

II. CALENDAR

CHARTER RIGHT
1. That the City Manager is requested to work with the Traffic, Parking and Transportation
Department to develop a small business parking pilot that would allow temporary on-street
employee parking during typical daytime operating hours. CHARTER RIGHT EXERCISED BY
MAYOR MCGOVERN
POR 2018 #133
Councillor Mallon, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED BY SUBSTITUTION 5-4-0

UNFINISHED BUSINESS
2. Transmitting Communication from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to an order
requesting the appropriation and authorization to borrow $5,000,000 to provide funds for the
Municipal Facilities Improvement Plan. PASSED TO SECOND READING AT THE CITY
COUNCIL MEETING OF APRIL 23, 2018, AND ON OR AFTER MAY 7, 2018 THE
QUESTION COMES ON ADOPTION.
CMA 2018 #83
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

Next: 5/21/2018 5:30 PM

3. Transmitting Communication from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to an order
requesting the appropriation and authorization to borrow $650,000 to provide funds for various
School building infrastructure projects, and a new boiler at an Cambridge Rindge and Latin
School. PASSED TO SECOND READING AT THE CITY COUNCIL MEETING OF
APRIL 23, 2018, AND ON OR AFTER MAY 7, 2018 THE QUESTION COMES ON
ADOPTION.
CMA 2018 #84
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

PAGE 3

Next: 5/21/2018 5:30 PM

May 14, 2018

4. Transmitting Communication from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to an order
requesting the appropriation and authorization to borrow $61,500,000 to provide funds for
various water pollution abatement projects, including construction of sewer separation, storm
water management and combined sewer overflow reduction elimination improvements within the
The Port neighborhood, and the River Street neighborhood. PASSED TO SECOND READING
AT THE CITY COUNCIL MEETING OF APRIL 23, 2018, AND ON OR AFTER MAY 7,
2018 THE QUESTION COMES ON ADOPTION.
CMA 2018 #85
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

Next: 5/21/2018 5:30 PM

5. Transmitting Communication from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to an order
requesting the appropriation and authorization to borrow $21,000,000 to provide funds for the
reconstruction of various City streets and sidewalks. PASSED TO SECOND READING AT
THE CITY COUNCIL MEETING OF APRIL 23, 2018, AND ON OR AFTER MAY 7,
2018 THE QUESTION COMES ON ADOPTION.
CMA 2018 #86
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

PAGE 4

Next: 5/21/2018 5:30 PM

May 14, 2018

III. APPLICATIONS AND PETITIONS
1. A petition was received from Sue Butler, et al, regarding concerns of excessive speed on Clinton
Street in mid-Cambridge, requesting the City install three speed bumps or speed platforms along the
length of Clinton Street
APP 2018 #313
RESULT:
REFERRED TO THE CITY MANAGER

2. A petition was received from Cambridge Arts Council requesting eleven temporary banners to be
hung on light poles along the north bound traffic lane side of First Street between Binney and
Cambridge Streets, announcing the Cambridge Arts River Festival, along the East Cambridge
Waterfront in Lechmere Canal Park and in the DCR parklands adjacent to Cambridge Parkway.
Banner will be on display on Monday May 15, 2018 through Monday June 4, 2018.
APP 2018 #314
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

3. An application was received from the Harvard Square Business Association requesting permission for
thirty-eight temporary banners on electrical poles in Harvard Square announcing "Welcome to
Harvard Square” the banners will be hung from June 15, 2018 and remain until November 30, 2018.
APP 2018 #315
RESULT:
RECONSIDERATION FILED BY VICE MAYOR DEVEREUX ON ORDER
ADOPTED

PAGE 5

May 14, 2018

IV. COMMUNICATIONS
1. A communication was received from Peter Valentine, regarding the parking problem.
COM 380 #2018
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

2. A communication was received from Robert J. La Tremouille, regarding more Government,
destruction at Magazine beach.
COM 381 #2018
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

3. A communication was received from Arthur Strang, Fresh Pond Parkway, regarding review the
transparent guidance about the use of force by Cambridge Police Department.
COM 382 #2018
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

4. A communication was received from Bob La Tremouille, regarding Palmer Street.
COM 383 #2018
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

5. A communication was received from Virginia Johnson, 1343 Cambridge Street, regarding support of
the small business parking pilot program.
COM 384 #2018
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

6. A communication was received from Hasson Rashid, regarding adding Ramadan 2018.
COM 385 #2018
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

7. A communication was received from Philip Chassier, 82 Cushing Street, regarding support of
divestment of Hewlett Packard.
COM 386 #2018
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

May 14, 2018

RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

parking permits.

RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

Tree Canopy report.

PLACED ON FILE

May 14, 2018

16. Communication received from Jocelyn Viterna 10, Shady Hill Square, regarding Calendar Item # 1 as
it relates to parking permits for teachers from 7 AM to 4:30 PM.
COM 395 #2018
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

17. Communication received from Eliza Dodge, 304 Arsenal Street, Watertown, an educator at the
Fletcher Maynard Academy regarding Calendar Item # 1 as it relates to parking permits for teachers.
COM 396 #2018
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

18. Communication received Carol O’Hare, 172 Magazine Street, relating to Policy Order # 1 regarding
the proposed Outdoor Lighting Ordinance.
COM 397 #2018
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

PAGE 8

May 14, 2018

V. RESOLUTIONS
1. Commending Jill Cowie for her advocacy on behalf of immigrant rights.
Councillor Toomey and entire membership.
RES 2018 #162
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

2. Congratulations to Dr. Bernat Olle on his nomination for the 2018 Immigrant Entrepreneur Award
and in recognizing the outstanding contributions his business has made to the City of Cambridge and
Massachusetts’ economic well-being.
Mayor McGovern and entire membership.
RES 2018 #163
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

3. Congratulations to Dr. Jonathan Thon on his nomination for the 2018 Immigrant Entrepreneur Award
and in recognizing the outstanding contributions his business has made to the City of Cambridge and
Massachusetts’ economic well-being.
Mayor McGovern and entire membership.
RES 2018 #164
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

4. Congratulations to Professor Guangping Gao on his nomination for the 2018 Immigrant Entrepreneur
Award and in recognizing the outstanding contributions his business has made to the City of
Cambridge and Massachusetts’ economic well-being.
Mayor McGovern and entire membership.
RES 2018 #165
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

5. That the City Council go on record welcoming Ramadan and extending its best wishes to the Muslim
community for a blessed month.
Councillor Siddiqui, Mayor McGovern and entire membership.
RES 2018 #166
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

6. Congratulations to Matthew Boyes-Watson and Zachary Baum on the opening of their new retail and
community space.
Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Mallon and entire membership.
RES 2018 #167
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

PAGE 9

May 14, 2018

7. Congratulations to Kelly Hassett on her accomplishments and graduation.
Councillor Siddiqui and entire membership.
RES 2018 #168
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

8. Resolution on the death of Jennie Panico.
Councillor Toomey and entire membership.
RES 2018 #169
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

9. Retirement of Stephen Kervick from the Cambridge Police Department.
Mayor McGovern and entire membership.
RES 2018 #170
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

10. Congratulating Paul Ryder for being named the 2018 Fresh Pond Stewardship Award recipient.
Mayor McGovern and entire membership.
RES 2018 #171
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

11. Congratulations to Richard Rossi for being named the 2018 Fresh Pond Stewardship Award recipient.
Mayor McGovern and entire membership.
RES 2018 #172
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

12. Congratulations to Y2Y on the occasion of receiving the 2018 New England Innovation Award.
Mayor McGovern and entire membership.
RES 2018 #173
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

PAGE 10

May 14, 2018

VI. POLICY ORDER AND RESOLUTION LIST
1. That the City Manager is requested to report back to the City Council by June 11 with an updated
schedule for resubmitting a revised draft of the Outdoor Lighting Ordinance that incorporates
suggestions from the Light Cambridge Committee.
POR 2018 #137
Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Carlone
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

2. That the City Manager is requested to prioritize revitalization of the Gannett-Warren Pals Park and
take action on the suggestions brought forward by the neighbors.
POR 2018 #138
Councillor Zondervan, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Toomey
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

3. That the City Manager is requested to explore the possibility of improving road safety conditions on
Clinton Street.
POR 2018 #139
Councillor Zondervan, Mayor McGovern, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Carlone
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

4. That the City Manager is requested to complete a tree canopy study based on the April 2018 LiDAR
data before the end of 2018, and to complete future LiDAR based studies as frequently as possible,
but no more often than once a year.
POR 2018 #140
Councillor Zondervan, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Kelley
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

PAGE 11

May 14, 2018
